frame.name: Sent_items
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Sent_item</fen> is prepared for, received after, or involved in a process of Sending, which may involve a particular kind of <fen>Transport_means</fen>. The <fen>Sent_item</fen> has an (intended or actual) <fen>Sender</fen> and <fen>Recipient</fen> (or a <fen>Source</fen> and <fen>Goal</fen>). As a physical object, the <fen>Sent_item</fen> can be located in a <fen>Place</fen>.
<ex>The <fex name="sen"><t>shipment</t></fex> <fex name="Source">from Romania</fex> is destined for the Iraqi Police Forces.</ex>
<ex>Postage became more affordable and <fex name="Sent_item"><t>mail</t></fex> <fex name="Recipient">to the President</fex> gradually increased.</ex>
<ex>I 'll arrange for her to collect <fex name="Recipient">Bertha 's</fex> <fex name="sen"><t>mail</t></fex>.</ex>
<ex>i am looking for a penpal for email or <fex name="tra">snail</fex> <fex name="Sent_item"><t>mail</t></fex>.</ex>
<ex>He had plenty of time to read all <fex name="Recipient">his</fex> <fex name="Sender">fan</fex> <fex name="Sent_item"><t>mail</t></fex> <fex name="Source">from Australia</fex> while there.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Sender
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is the person or organization who initiates the movement of the <fen>Sent_item</fen> and, unlike in the case of Carrying, does not accompany it.
<ex>Today's <t>mail</t> <fex name="Sender">from eBay</fex> brought me a copy of this book.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root>The end of the path and intended goal of the sending.
<ex>My <t>shipment</t> <fex name="Goal">to Australia</fex> was received in 10 days.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The beginning of the path, similar to source except that it serves to define the path.
<ex><t>Mail</t> <fex name="Source">from England</fex> to our office is sent registered mail.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Sent_item
FE.definition:
<def-root>The objects being sent.
<ex>Today the <fex name="sen"><t>post</t></fex> contained a pair of brand new tyres from Continental.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Transport_means
FE.definition:
<def-root>The mode of sending employed.
<ex>We promise to expedite your <fex name="tra">air</fex> <t>mail</t> as agreed.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Recipient
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is the recipient of the sent <fen>Sent_item</fen>
<ex>He went to the study and examined <fex name="Recipient">his</fex> mail</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>When an interaction with the <fen>Sent_item</fen> occurs.
<ex>Finally, <fex name="Time">today's</fex> <t>mail</t> contained yet another book by the same author.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The place in which the Sent_item is located.
<ex>After that, I notice the <t>mail</t> <fex name="Place">on the table</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any characterizations or evaluations of the the <fen>Sent_item</fen> that introduce another frame, in which the <fen>Sent_item</fen> figures.
<ex>A cat could have kittens before the <fex name="des">stupid</fex> <t>shipment</t> rolled in.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: mail.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: letters and parcels sent by post.

lexUnit.name: shipment.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a consignment of goods shipped.
